answerText: Yenisei River[10] In 2009, one of the biggest dam disasters in Russian history occurred on the Yenisei at this dam, the largest power plant in Russia, killing 75 people when the engine and turbine rooms were flooded after a turbine detached from its bearings and flew 50 feet in the air.
heading: DEES |2014 | VCU A-Carleton A | 11 | Geography | None | College
subject: Geography
question: Question: The Ket people historically lived in the basin of this river, which terminates in a namesake gulf in the Kara Sea.  [10] Name this Siberian river, which is the largest of the three that flows into the Arctic Ocean and is thus way cooler than the Ob and Lena rivers.
